Visualizing results¶

You may of course use the visualization software of your choice to plot the results, but pynoise also includes some simple routines for some of the most common tasks. These routines all rely on matplotlib for the plotting.

Note

If you are running these commands from a Python shell, you may also need to run the matplotlib command show() to actually show the plots. This depends on your local setup.

pynoise.plot_visibility_slice(parameters, visibility_slice=None, **kwargs)¶

Make an image plot of a visibility slice.

Only the real part is plotted

Parameters:
  • parameters (Parameters structure) : the structure holding

the parameters

Kwargs:
  • visibility_slice (numpy array) : the slice to plot. If none is given,

a slice is generated from the Parameters structure.

Additional kwargs are passed to imshow

pynoise.plot_psf(parameters, **kwargs)¶

Make an image plot of the point spread function

Parameters:
  • parameters (Parameters structure) — the structure holding the

    parameters

pynoise.plot_image_slice(parameters, image_slice=None, **kwargs)¶

Make an image plot of a image slice.

Parameters:
  • parameters (Parameters structure) : the structure holding

the parameters

Kwargs:
  • image_slice (numpy array) : the slice to plot. If none is given,

a slice is generated from the Parameters structure.

Additional kwargs are passed to imshow
